edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption

Class ScElGamalKEM

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.ElGamalAbs
      • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.ScElGamalKEM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsymmetricEnc, ElGamalEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel

    public class ScElGamalKEM
extends ElGamalAbs
    This class performs the El Gamal KEM encryption scheme. By definition, this encryption scheme is CPA-secure.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor that gets a DlogGroup, KDF, symmetric encryption and source of randomness.
      ScElGamalKEM(java.lang.String dlogName, java.lang.String kdfName, SymmetricEnc encryption, int symKeySize)
      Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name and kdf name to create and sets them to the underlying members.
      ScElGamalKEM(java.lang.String dlogName, java.lang.String kdfName, SymmetricEnc encryption, int symKeySize, java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
      Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name, kdf name and random number generator to use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScElGamalKEM

        public ScElGamalKEM()
        Default constructor. Uses the default implementations of DlogGroup, KDF, SymmetricEncryption and SecureRandom.

      • ScElGamalKEM

        public ScElGamalKEM(DlogGroup dlogGroup,
                    KeyDerivationFunction kdf,
                    SymmetricEnc encryption,
                    int symKeySize)
             throws SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup, KDF and symmetric encryption and sets them. It lets SCAPI choose the source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroup - must be DDH secure.
        kdf -
        encryption - MUST be CPA-secure.
        symKeySize - Size of the key to set the given symmetric encryption, in BITS.
        Throws:
        SecurityLevelException - if the given dlog group does not have DDH security level.
        SecurityLevelException - if the given encryption is not CPA-secure.

      • ScElGamalKEM

        public ScElGamalKEM(DlogGroup dlogGroup,
                    KeyDerivationFunction kdf,
                    SymmetricEnc encryption,
                    int symKeySize,
                    java.security.SecureRandom random)
             throws SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup, KDF, symmetric encryption and source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroup - must be DDH secure.
        random - source of randomness.
        kdf -
        encryption - MUST be CPA-secure.
        symKeySize - Size of the key to set the given symmetric encryption, in BITS.
        Throws:
        SecurityLevelException - if the given dlog group does not have DDH security level.
        SecurityLevelException - if the given encryption is not CPA-secure.

      • ScElGamalKEM

        public ScElGamalKEM(java.lang.String dlogName,
                    java.lang.String kdfName,
                    SymmetricEnc encryption,
                    int symKeySize)
             throws FactoriesException,
                    SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name and kdf name to create and sets them to the underlying members. The constructor also gets the underlying SymmetricEncryption to use. It does not get the name of the encryption since there is no factory for the Symmetric encryption so it cannot be created by name. Uses default implementation of SecureRandom.
        Parameters:
        dlogName - must be DDH secure.
        kdfName -
        encryption - MUST be CPA-secure.
        symKeySize - Size of the key to set the given symmetric encryption, in BITS.
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if the creation of the dlog failed.
        SecurityLevelException - if the given dlog group does not have DDH security level.
        SecurityLevelException - if the given encryption is not CPA-secure.

      • ScElGamalKEM

        public ScElGamalKEM(java.lang.String dlogName,
                    java.lang.String kdfName,
                    SymmetricEnc encryption,
                    int symKeySize,
                    java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
             throws FactoriesException,
                    java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                    SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name, kdf name and random number generator to use. The constructor also gets the underlying SymmetricEncryption to use. It does not get the name of the encryption since there is no factory for the Symmetric encryption so it cannot be created by name.
        Parameters:
        dlogName - must be DDH-secure.
        kdfName -
        encryption - MUST be CPA-secure.
        symKeySize - Size of the key to set the given symmetric encryption, in BITS.
        randNumGenAlg -
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if the creation of the dlog failed.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the given random number generator is not supported.
        SecurityLevelException - if the given dlog group does not have DDH security level.
        SecurityLevelException - if the given encryption is not CPA-secure.

    • Method Detail

      • hasMaxByteArrayLengthForPlaintext

        public boolean hasMaxByteArrayLengthForPlaintext()
        ElGamalKEM encryption scheme has no limit of the byte array length to generate a plaintext from.
        Returns:
        false.

      • getMaxLengthOfByteArrayForPlaintext

        public int getMaxLengthOfByteArrayForPlaintext()
        ElGamalKEM encryption can get any plaintext length.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of the byte array that can be passed to generatePlaintext function.
        Throws:
        NoMaxException.

      • generatePlaintext

        public Plaintext generatePlaintext(byte[] text)
        Generates a Plaintext suitable to ElGamal encryption scheme from the given message.
        Parameters:
        text - byte array to convert to a Plaintext object.

      • decrypt

        public Plaintext decrypt(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher)
                  throws java.security.KeyException
        Decrypts the given ciphertext using ElGamal encryption scheme.
        Parameters:
        cipher - MUST be of type ElGamalKEMCiphertext contains the cipher to decrypt.
        Returns:
        Plaintext of type ByteArrayPlaintext which containing the decrypted message.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyException - if no private key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given cipher is not instance of ElGamalOnByteArrayCiphertext.

      • generateBytesFromPlaintext

        public byte[] generateBytesFromPlaintext(Plaintext plaintext)
        Generates a byte array from the given plaintext. This function should be used when the user does not know the specific type of the Asymmetric encryption he has, and therefore he is working on byte array.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - to generates byte array from. MUST be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        Returns:
        the byte array generated from the given plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.

      • generateCiphertext

        @Deprecated
public AsymmetricCiphertext generateCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Deprecated. As of SCAPI-V1-0-2-2 use reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Generates (reconstructs) a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
        See Also:
        AsymmetricEnc.generateCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)

      • reconstructCiphertext

        public AsymmetricCiphertext reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
        See Also:
        AsymmetricEnc.reconstructCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)
